content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution for this problem:
```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame) 
    df[:ym] = map(d -> year(d)*100 + month(d), df.dt)
end
```
You can use the function like this:
```julia
df = DataFrame(dt = [DateTime(2020,1,1), DateTime(2021,3,4), DateTime(2022,5,6)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will add a new column `ym` in the data frame which contains the year and month from the DateTimes in the format "yyyymm".
